title: Timothy B. Ruel
text:
Enthusiastic data scientist with a passion for leveraging statistical expertise to construct models, formulate predictions, and address real-world challenges through the power of data. Proficient in utilizing R and Python for data wrangling and implementing machine learning techniques.
I am currently in my fifth year as a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at Northwestern University. My research focuses on developing a novel algorithm for the numerical approximation of integrated likelihood functions. This innovative approach aims to eliminate nuisance parameters from statistical models, providing scientific researchers with a tool to facilitate the estimation of the parameters of interest in their studies.

title: The ‘generalizeR’ R package
text:
The ‘generalizeR’ R package
 
 
 
 


The ‘generalizeR’ R package




 
The ‘generalizeR’ is an R package implementation of the webtool thegeneralizer.org. Its purpose is to guide primary and secondary education researchers (K-12) through the process of (1) designing a sample recruitment plan with generalization in mind and (2) reporting where the results of a study may (or may not) generalize well.
